fields.headline: Everton striker gets the boot
fields.bodyText: Everton have decided to end Danny Cadamarteri's days at Goodison Park after he was found guilty of punching a woman. The 21-year-old striker will be allowed to leave "when suitable arrangements can be made". Cadamarteri was fined £2,000 this month for punching a young woman in the face during a late-night fracas in October. The club have also agreed that the player will donate to local charities a sum equivalent to the amount of legal aid he received to fight his case. Cadamarteri has offered to devote a substantial amount of his time to assisting Everton's Football in the Community scheme. An Everton spokesman said: "The player acknowledges that his actions brought discredit to himself, his family and his club, resulting in unnecessary and potentially damaging publicity. He wishes to offer a full and public apology." Southampton have released the striker Uwe Rösler on a free transfer. The former German international started the first three Premiership matches of the season but lost his place in last week's Worthington Cup match at Brighton.
